page.title: 16VEHICLES;DESCRIPTION,DRIVERS
page.content: The most popular car colour, we found was blue. Red, the country's most popular colour, was only our second most popular. Most trucks and goods vehicles were white. The least popular colour was orange. On the bypass there were about 207 men and only 47 women drivers. The men were probably travelling between work. All the vans, minibuses and lorries that we saw were driven by male drivers.We saw a lot of old people. At Gibbet Hill there were 172 men and 54 women, a lot of them driving old cars. Most of the cars in poor condition were heading for the University. They were probably students' cars. We found that a lot of the cars were going to the University or to Coventry. Out of 278 cars on the bypass 62 were 'B' registration.
